instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: MacBook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not turning on.
threads.message:
Green light on charging port ,will not turn to pink after battery pluged in. 
voltage readings. 
PPBUS=12.56V
PP3V42=3.419V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>=3.315v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>=not present
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL>=4.999V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>=not present

threads.title: MacBook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not turning on.
threads.message:
This board doesn't turn on by itself.
You must trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>, in the diagnose process.

Amber light must come on if good battery is connected.
Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Not turning on.
